bib.title: biodivMapR: An r package for α‐ and β‐diversity mapping using remotely sensed images
bib.author: Jean‐Baptiste Féret and Florian De Boissieu
bib.abstract: The accelerated erosion of biodiversity is a critical environmental challenge. Operational methods for the monitoring of biodiversity taking advantage of remotely sensed data are needed in order to provide information to ecologists and decision‐makers. We present an R package designed to compute a selection of α‐ and β‐diversity indicators from optical imagery, based on spectral variation hypothesis. This package builds upon previous work on biodiversity mapping using airborne imaging spectroscopy, and has been adapted in order to process broader range of data sources, including Sentinel‐2 satellite images. biodivMapR is able to produce α‐diversity maps including Shannon and Simpson indices, as well as β‐diversity maps derived from Bray–Curtis dissimilarity.
